author: cardanopoolpeek1
title: Fair Stake Pool Economy
description: Many sites priorities ranking over other metrics for pool selection, paid for advertising or methods for SPO's to attract new delegation.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would support ADA holders to delegate, by giving them better and fairer information, and increasing their understanding of stakepools and delegation issues; so this would probably increase their "meaningful" onboarding into Cardano - but this challenge is about onboarding into *Catalyst* per se, not only into Cardano. Although this site is a good idea and no doubt has some positive effects on the Cardano ecosystem (particularly for smaller stakepools), it doesn't address engaging people with Catalyst as proposers, voters, CAs, etc; in fact, the word "Catalyst" does not even appear anywhere in the proposal text. If there is a way that it would address Catalyst onboarding, the proposer has unfortunately not explained it; so reluctantly I have to rate this as "no, it doesn't address the challenge".
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has some good features on feasibility. The proposal team clearly has the knowledge needed to deliver it; and it looks reasonably well-planned: I like the way the proposer has linked their timeline and budget together so we can see what costs will be at each stage. The proposer has also accurately identified several risks; and although their mitigation could be expressed a bit more clearly, it *is* there. But the most important element of the planning is not very clear: the actual purpose of doing the site upgrade is not spelled out, and the description of the "proposed solution" describes the site itself, rather than the upgrade project for which funding is being sought. There is some mention of attracting new site users - but if this is the only aim, then I would say that more would need to be spent on marketing to make the proposal feasible. There are also mentions of "project goals and KPIs" and "clear targets", but these do not actually appear as such in the proposal - it would be particularly helpful to see the targets spelled out, so we can see if they are reasonable and feasible. In other words, the proposal doesn't say what problem it will solve, or why it's necessary to do these upgrades; this makes it hard to assess whether the proposal will be implemented *successfully* (i.e. will it succeed in achieving what it's supposed to?) or to fully assess the feasibility of its goals. Without sufficient information, I can neither agree nor disagree on feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: On audit, the proposer suggest measuring basic site usage and the implementation of new tools and updates, which is a good start, and transparent. But I would like to see some thought given to "cause and effect" - in other words, if there is a change in the site usage, how far can we attribute it to what has been done in this project in terms of upgrades and new tools, and how can we know that it wasn't caused by something else? And, since the proposal says that what success looks like would include "To help educate new users on the importance of selecting a Stake Pool and help make Cardano a healthy ecosystem for future generations", I'd like to see some way of measuring that - how will we know if site users *are* actually being educated on the importance of selecting a stakepool, rather than being mainly people who already know all about it? So although the suggested audit measures will give some useful information, the actual success and point of the proposal can't entirely be audited, so I can neither agree nor disagree that the proposal overall is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Unfortunately this intriguing proposal for a SPO tool that benefits the smallest pools just doesn't line up with the challenge setting it has been submitted in.  Presumably the author believes the alignment comes by considering new SPO, or new stakers looking for small or single pools, to need onboarding help in the form of their tool.  But the challenge setting is dedicated to onboarding new members to Catalyst specifically, by increasing or improving proposals, educational resources for Catalyst roles, that sort of thing.  The  pool tool itself (poolpeek) seems like a really great idea though, so the team is encouraged to polish it based on any advice they receive and see if a better funding opportunity presents itself in Fund9.  In the current fund, a better setting would have been either the Dapps and Integrations, possibly Cardano Scaling Solutions, and of course, Miscellaneous.  As far as the impact this proposal could have had, the ability to connect the poolpeek tool with wallets so they can find and track and save their favorite charity pools or single pool operators would be a welcome addition, as much for the connector as for supporting small pools.   The ability torun rotating, free ad space is an obvious solution, if not the most mercenary one, and you could imagine such a tool allowing for "get to know the SPO" type advertising as well.
f6_assessments.q1: While the prototype site is up and looks nice and navigates well, there really aren't any useful details regarding just what is being worked on, what is finished, what specifically will be built out with the funding...are we talking about integration with wallets via a dapp connector?  Does the project require team members beyond the 3 SPOs behind the team?  What skills do they have as a team that are applicable to this project?  There is no timeline provided, just a general statement of "3-6 months" that doesn't help us understand what the steps are along the way, or what gets delivered when.  There is simply no way to tell what the team could deliver or what they couldn't.  For example they suggest installing a chat bot will help...but no clues are given as to how.  Will it be a Q&A AI?  The website indicates a place for a pool wizard tool, so maybe that is what they are referring to?  The layout of the proposal needs to be revisited to clearly show, at a minimum, actionable tasks and their order, a funding breakdown tied to deliverables and a description of the specific architecture and technology they are trying to implement.  Knowing what they want to accomplish is only the first step of a plan:  how they plan to accomplish it is important too.
f6_assessments.q2: A rough schedule of 3-6 months without any particular milestones or their order is all that is presented, and the listed KPIs come up short, especially in light of the challenge this has been submitted in.  To the degree that we lean on the provided KPIs to gauge progress...well, they are lacking.  Knowing the visitor traffic to the website really doesn't tell us anything about adoption of Catalyst or Cardano even (it really signals little more than interest), and it doesn't even help understand to what degree the stated goal of decentralization has been acheived.  If submitted to a different challenge, the best KPIs for a proposal of this nature would have to be rate of change to registered SPOs for the service, effectiveness of the free advertising in both getting eyes on SPO pages and securing stake, and perhaps user satisfaction for the the chatbot or wizard, whichever they are planning on implementing.

f6_assessments.q0: The category of “New Member Onboarding” relates specifically to Project Catalyst.  The solutions provided in this proposal address primarily helping SPOs attract delegators in a fair manner and helping new delegators find stake pools that match their parameters.  This proposal also has educational tools to help delegators differentiate between pools and make informed decisions.  Removing ADA from exchanges and into self custody is an important step for new users of Cardano.  While this is certainly a need in the community and a current conversation in the ecosystem, I do not think this proposal will meet the goals of this category.  In fund 8, the “Miscellaneous” category may have been the appropriate choice.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is made by a team that appears to be highly capable.  Documentation includes relevant experience and a long standing commitment to the Cardano community.  This team has already hosted this website for 12 months without any outside funding, including advertisements.  I have no doubt this team can implement the proposal.  The timeline presented is reasonable and they plan to offer weekly updates on progress.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team plans to give regular updates on the progress of the installation of a new server to host the website and implementation of new features.  The team also mentions an updated roadmap for the project to keep the community informed of the direction of the website.
I believe the team intends to provide measurable metrics that would track site visits, new users, etc.  I think the proposal could be improved even further if the team considered ways to measure SPOs perceived value of the website and educational value to new users staking for the first time.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project idea is aimed at counteracting the unfair prioritization of stake pools in various platforms and misleading those wishing to delegate ADA. The solution offered is "to increase decentralization, spread delegation across Community SPO's, with fairer platform without rankings & free promotion".

In the impact section, the applicant describes an existing fully operational website and its functionality, which is aimed at solving the identified problem. I do not see explanation and justification of how the current funding (of the project) will change or add value to the existing website.

There is no clearly defined benefit and added value for the community resulting from the current funding beyond the already existing benefits.
f6_assessments.q1:
As this is an existing website, it is not specifically explained how the proposed activities (Transfer all site capability to new equipment, update existing capabilities, integrate mobile software & test) will serve to implement the solution addressing the identified problem (to increase decentralization, spread delegation across Community SPO's, with fairer platform without rankings & free promotion).

I miss details and specifics in the timeline offered. Budget is divided into general categories and roles without braking it in prices and expenses.

Instead of offering personal expertise of people involved in the implementation of the project, that proofs team’s capacity to implement it, the Stake pools website links are provided.
f6_assessments.q2: In order for the proposal to be auditable I would like to see a detailed roadmap with milestones and time horizon. As well as KPIs identified and set with specific measurable quantities. I miss both timeline and KPIs  in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This would be an interesting addition to the SPO community, the proposer has identified an niche by providing the general ADA user a tool to search SPO's based on randomness. I do not see how this will gain massive traction, though the proposer states that this is not the intention. The intention is create a fair playing field. Is this effective? Perhaps not, for the regular ADA users would like to be involved in a SPO that is producing blocks. Just an idea to the proposer, perhaps they can tweak this tool to allow searching SPO based on their mission or value added back to the community. Perhaps, a search engine that helps us find out which SPO is donating to a charity. From there we can dig deeper into this SPO to see what that charity is all about.

As interesting as this idea is, unfortunately though this does not meet the key metrics of this Challenge. It would perhaps fit better with this Challenge if this website was to provide a search category to find which SPO's support onboarding onto Catalyst or Cardano. Then the proposers initial intent will also coincide with this Challenge's key metrics. At it's current state this proposal I reckon would fit better in the "Developer Ecosystem" and "Dapps and Integrations". In Fund 7 there was a category for SPO's but unfortunately it did not carry through to Fund 8. Perhaps the proposer should also consider submitting in "Miscl. Challenge".
f6_assessments.q1: Based on the credentials provided, Shamrock Pool and BraveHeart Pool will highly likely deliver on their proposal. Not only just because they are SPO themselves but the solutions provided coincide with the technical know-how needed to deliver on their solution. This seems to be a passion project of these two stake pools and passion goes a long way in life. They have also clearly identified the needs of additional post to complement their existing team, a Software Architect and a Mobile Integration individuals. This would tie into their plans of making this site accessible through mobiles. Both timeline and budget plan are fairly detailed but most importantly reasonable. For what they are basically doing is upgrading a working site and not creating from scratch. Something they have done with no initial funding form outsourced parties. The final note that eliminates any doubt regarding their capability to deliver is their continued involvement in the community, by being involved in the monitoring of SundaeSwaps scoopers proves they care about the health of our ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: They have numerous avenues for the community and IOG to track their progress. Starting from a GitHub to track their development progress to a Medium that will provide general viewer friendly reports that can be easily be read. A specific website is also provided including a bonus video content in Shamrocks YouTube channel that informs the community on new features of the website. Stellar job! Again unfortunate it's in this Challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: I support this proposal as I've been using the website since Sundaeswap ISPO. The website is very informative without those disturbing ads. The big idea behind this is what I really appreciated, providing assistance and helping to promote other pools without asking anything in return. This truly resembles the spirit of decentralization and for the greater good of Cardano communities.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe the team can deliver the project as they've been experienced as stake pool operators. The budget breakdown also makes sense. However, the team should consider sparing some time if there are some unthinkable issues that could happen during the implementation process.
f6_assessments.q2: Anyone in the community can always check the website for any updated information provided that this project successfully got funded from this Fund 8. The Medium post is also a plus point with its social media channels, such as Twitter & Discord. One more thing to add is, it will be good to have any future plans mapped out on the website as it will be a nice to know kind of thing.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal states a solution to a problem that is out of the scope of the challenge in which it is participating, therefore taking funds that the community has voted to assign for New Member Onboarding. Having said that, the problem that the proposer aims to resolve with this proposal is a very important one regarding the way in which SPO can be found by delegators, aiming to higher decentralization of delegation though a better way of showing information to delegators. A very relevant issue for Cardano. The solution is not new since it has already been in place for a year. The ask is to scale something that is already in place. This brings me to the quantification of the impact of this proposal. SPO Centralization has kept rising during the last year, it’s hard to know if this had any effect in mitigating that at all.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan, timeline and budget are simple and clear, the proposer has a proven track record since he has been successfully doing it for a year. I am confident the feasibility of implementation is very high.
The metrics proposed are mostly for the deployment of new hardware and the further development of their ongoing initiative. It would be great if the proposer could com up with a way of measuring how much impact they are having on SPO decentralization.
f6_assessments.q2: The community should be able to easily keep track of the implementation, the proposal is clear and easy to audit.
